intro: Phthirusa caucana, commonly known as the Caucasian phthirusa, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
